results.title: Bip as a skater
results.creator_credit: John Barnes, John Barnes Productions and Encyclopaedia Britannica Films
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “The Art of silence: pantomimes with Marcel Marceau and his partner Pierre Verry”.
This Bip pantomime deals with his visit to a skating rink. Featuring Marcel Marceau.

results.title: Bioshock Infinite
results.brief_description: This first-person follows Booker DeWitt as he enters the floating independent (formerly US) city of Columbia in 1912 and attempts to retrieve a girl trapped in a tower by the city’s self-proclaimed despot/prophet in order to erase his financial debt.

constellations_other.name: Action, emotion and videogames
constellations_other.description: More and more, videogames are beginning to favour emotion as much as action, just like their film and TV cousins.

constellations_other.name: There's always a lighthouse
constellations_other.description: The thaumatrope was an early optical illusion device popular in the Victorian era and was important to the development of the moving image.

results.description: Indebted to the wrong people, with his life on the line, veteran of the U.S. Cavalry and now hired gun, Booker DeWitt has only one opportunity to wipe his slate clean. He must rescue Elizabeth, a mysterious girl imprisoned since childhood and locked up in the flying city of Columbia. Forced to trust one another, Booker and Elizabeth form a powerful bond during their daring escape. Together, they learn to harness an expanding arsenal of weapons and abilities, as they fight on zeppelins in the clouds, along high-speed Sky-Lines, and down in the streets of Columbia, all while surviving the threats of the air-city and uncovering its dark secret.
description_for_label: Indebted to the wrong people, with his life on the line, veteran of the U.S. Cavalry and now hired gun, Booker DeWitt has only one opportunity to wipe his slate clean. He must rescue Elizabeth, a mysterious girl imprisoned since childhood and locked up in the flying city of Columbia. Forced to trust one another, Booker and Elizabeth form a powerful bond during their daring escape. Together, they learn to harness an expanding arsenal of weapons and abilities, as they fight on zeppelins in the clouds, along high-speed Sky-Lines, and down in the streets of Columbia, all while surviving the threats of the air-city and uncovering its dark secret.

results.title: BioShock
results.brief_description: Set in the Objectivist underwater dystopia of Rapture in the ‘60’s, Bioshock is a first-person shooter with the premise of arming and genetically modifying yourself in order to survive against the city’s resident great minds-turned-maddened anomalies and aid Atlas in his mission to overthrow the city’s cruel ruler, Andrew Ryan.

constellations_other.name: Little, big worlds
constellations_other.description: Wes Anderson's stop-motion animation film draws on tried-and-true techniques that, despite the rise of computer-generated imagery, still inspire filmmakers and game-makers.

results.description: BioShock takes place in 1960 in the middle of the Atlantic Ocean, where Jack, sole survivor of a plane crash, discovers the entrance to the recluse underwater city of Rapture, at the end of a civil war which left most of this utopia in disrepair. Finding himself in an alien world, he has no choice but to fight for his survival against the Splicers, degenerated citizens addicted to the genetic material known as ADAM, and all the traps laid down by the city’s visionary founder, Andrew Ryan. His only help lies in Atlas, a revolutionary man seeking to escape safely to the surface with his family.
description_for_label: BioShock takes place in 1960 in the middle of the Atlantic Ocean, where Jack, sole survivor of a plane crash, discovers the entrance to the recluse underwater city of Rapture, at the end of a civil war which left most of this utopia in disrepair. Finding himself in an alien world, he has no choice but to fight for his survival against the Splicers, degenerated citizens addicted to the genetic material known as ADAM, and all the traps laid down by the city’s visionary founder, Andrew Ryan. His only help lies in Atlas, a revolutionary man seeking to escape safely to the surface with his family.

results.title: Bionics: man or machine
results.creator_credit: Alan P. Sloan and Encyclopaedia Britannica Films
results.brief_description: Presents a brief history of bionics, the science of copying nature. Examines some of the successful machines that have been created as a result of bionic research, and investigates some possibilities for the future. Suitable for upper secondary level.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Alan P. Sloan and Encyclopaedia Britannica Films

results.title: Bioncle: mask of light
results.creator_credit: Terry Shakespeare, David Molina, Sue Shakespeare, Miramax Films and The Lego Group
results.brief_description: CGI animated feature about robot creatures called Bionicles who live by a code of Unity, Duty and Destiny. ‘Chronicle’ finds a hidden mask that is the mask of light - he must take this mask to find his destiny which is to be the 7th Toa. A good versus evil battle evolves as light battles with the dark Master of Shadow in a bid to free the island home of Mata Nui from darkness. Made by the Lego Company and sure to be enjoyed by young purchasers of BionicleTM products. Direction and Art Direction by David Molina and Terry Shakespeare with a screenplay by Henry Gilroy.

results.title: Biomagnetism
results.creator_credit: Celia Tait, Brian Beaton, SBS-TV and Reel Images
results.brief_description:
Episode number 6 of Series “The Nature of healing”.
This program looks at magnetic field therapy, an approach much researched, particularly in Japan. Biomagnetic therapy combined with drug therapy has been used to successfully treat depression, dementia, non-healing fractures and spinal injuries.

results.title: Biology program; unit 3. Animal life
results.brief_description: Series of programs intended for upper secondary level students. Introduces the study of animal life and provides examples of structure, life cycle, behavior and adaptation of various animal groups, eg amphibians, mammals, reptiles etc.
